III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but
not limited to: (iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth's
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member is yelling at youth, name calling, antagonizing and
“provoking” youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 4/24/2025 onsite visit was made to Methodist.
On 04/24/2025 an interview was completed with Staff 2. She
reported witnessing Staff 1 call Youth A “retarded”. She reported
she was present and saw Staff 1 “antagonize” Youth A. She
described the antagonizing behavior as following behind the youth
and not letting him walk away. She specifically stated she saw the
supervisor attempt to remove Youth A from an escalated situation
between Youth A and Staff 1, and Staff 1 refused redirect herself
and continued to follow behind the youth and followed him and the
supervisor into the office. She was unable to provide a date or
time when she recalled the incident to have occurred.
On 04/24/2025 an interview was completed with Youth C. He
denied having knowledge of Staff 1 calling Youth A or other youth
names. He reported that Staff 1 does not work a lot but denied
having any concerns when she has been working in his cottage.
On 04/24/2025 an interview was completed with Youth B. He
denied seeing or hearing Staff 1 be inappropriate with youth or call
youth names.
On 04/24/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Clinical
Services Director (CSD) at Methodist. He was advised of the
concerns/allegations that were expressed by Staff 2 regarding
Staff 1. He denied having any knowledge of inappropriate
interactions or name calling by Staff 1. He further advised that
Staff 1 is a contingent staff, meaning she picks up shifts with the
agency as needed, and does not work every day at the agency,
2

and is not on campus daily. Her contact number was provided to
complete an interview. On 05/01/2025 CSD provided copies of
incident reports involving Staff 1 and confirmed that Staff 1 was up
to date on her training. He further advised that she has worked for
the agency for about 7 months and does not have any discipline in
her HR file.
On 04/25/2025 an email correspondence was sent to assigned
Foster Care Worker (FCW) advising of assigned investigation.
He responded and indicated he did not have any concerns with
placement of youth.
Complainant was contacted and no further concerns were noted.
On 04/29/2025 an email correspondence was sent to Chief
Administrator and Clinical Services Director. CA was advised of
initiation of investigation and advised of the allegations.
On 05/01/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Methodist. He reported having an “amazing” relationship with
Staff 1 and denied she has ever called him retarded. He also
denied seeing or hearing Staff 1 yell or scream at Youth B or any
other youth. Youth A also reported that Youth B told him that he
was going to get Staff 1 in trouble. He stated Youth B is always
spreading rumors. Youth A stated he did not want to be
interviewed any longer and asked to leave.
On 05/01/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 3
at Methodist. He denied Staff 1 called Youth A retarded. He
denied witnessing or it being reported that Staff 1 would
antagonize or yell at the youth. He recalled working a shift with
both Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2 present, but denied any incident
occurred as reported by Staff 2. As a supervisor, he reported that
when youth or staff are escalated, he always engages in the
practice of removing the trigger and asking youth or staff to step
away and take a moment to calm themselves down.
On 05/08/2025 a telephone call was attempted to Staff 1 with no
success. A voicemail message was left requesting a return call.
Another attempt was made to contact Staff 1 via telephone on
5/19/2025 without success. On 06/02/2025 phone contact was
made with Staff 1. She denied calling Youth A retarded and
stated she does not engage in name calling or negative
interactions with any of the youth. She further denied recalling an
instance when she was “antagonizing” Youth A or followed behind
him and a supervisor in lieu of trying to deescalate. She reported
3

having a good relationship with Youth A and laughed at how he is
always trying to be wherever she is when she is at work. Staff 1
reported she is up to date with her training and denied having any
disciplinary action in her file. She continues to work in a
contingent status with the agency.
Documents Reviewed:
DHHS Social Work Contact – dated for 05/08/2025 – A telephone
call was placed to Parent 1 and Parent 2. They reported no
concerns with placement of Youth A. They reported meeting with
him frequently on campus and off campus and denied that Youth
A has ever reported concerns regarding Staff 1.
Methodist Agency Policy: Discipline and Consequences Policy -
Employees will only adhere to the behavior management
techniques as taught by MCHS. MCHS does not sanction any
form of corporal punishment and or inappropriate hands-on
intervention such as but not limited to pinching, spanking,
slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling hair, grabbing
pushing and threatening gestures.
Video Reviewed: There was no video footage to review as Staff
2 was unable to provide an estimated date or time when the
alleged incident occurred.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. After completion of
interviews with youth and staff, there was no evidence to support
that Staff 1 had engaged in the alleged actions. It was also noted
that Youth A denied that Staff 1 had called him names or was
involved in antagonizing him.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
